core.generalErrorMessage: Something went wrong, please check the configuration
core.title: Core Settings
deleteNode.prompt: Are you sure you want to delete the {{name}} node?
deleteNode.title: Delete Node
deleteUser.prompt: Are you sure you want to delete {{email}}?
deleteUser.title: Delete User
hostsDialog.dataLimit: The usage limit of the user
hostsDialog.dataUsage: The current usage of the user
hostsDialog.desc: Use these variables to make it dynamic
hostsDialog.fragment.info.attention: Attention: currently, this feature only supported in streisand >= 1.6.12 and v2rayNG >= 1.8.16 (custom config)
hostsDialog.noise.info.attention: Attention: currently, this feature only supported in streisand >= 1.6.32 and v2rayNG >= 1.8.39 (custom config)
hostsDialog.host.info: By default, if a request host is set in the Xray config, this host is used. However, you can set a custom request host here if needed.
hostsDialog.host.multiHost: To set multiple addresses, separate them with <badge>,</badge> Each time an address is chosen randomly.
hostsDialog.host.wildcard: Use <badge>*</badge> to generate a random string (works for wildcard domain names)
hostsDialog.jalaliExpireDate: Expiry date of the user in solar calendar
hostsDialog.path.info: Set a path for host users, useful behind a reverse proxy.
hostsDialog.port.info: By default, a host uses the default port of the inbound. You can set a custom port in case this host is a server that forwards traffic from a port that differs from your server's port. For example, the server may forward traffic from port 8443 to the default port of your inbound server.
hostsDialog.proxyOutbound.info: Extra outbound ( only in v2ray custom config )
hostsDialog.security.info: If the middleware server of this host uses a different security layer than the inbound's default, you can set a custom security layer here.
hostsDialog.sni.info: By default, a host uses the default SNI of the inbound. You can set a custom SNI in case this host is a server that has a different SNI. For example, the server may receive traffic with a different SSL certificate, perform SSL termination, and forward it to your inbound server.
hostsDialog.title: Using this setting, you are able to assign specific address for each inbound.
login.welcomeBack: Welcome back, please enter your details
nodes.addHostForEveryInbound: Add this node as a new host for every inbound
nodes.connection-hint: To setup a npoint Node, you need to set this certificate on the node to initialize a secure connection between main server and the node
nodes.title: Using npoint-node, you are able to scale up your connection quality by adding different nodes on different servers.
resetAllUsage.error: Usage reset failed, please try again.
resetAllUsage.prompt: This action clears all of the users' data usage completely. Are you sure you want to reset all usage? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
resetAllUsage.title: Reset data usage for all users
resetUserUsage.error: Usage reset failed, please try again.
resetUserUsage.prompt: Are you sure you want to reset {{email}}'s usage?
resetUserUsage.title: Reset User Usage
revokeUserSub.error: Subscription revoke failed, please try again.
revokeUserSub.prompt: Are you sure you want to revoke {{email}}'s subscription?
revokeUserSub.title: Revoke User Subscription
userDialog.selectOneProtocol: Please select at least one protocol
userDialog.shadowsocksDesc: Fast and secure, but not efficient as others
userDialog.warningNoProtocol: Please select at least one protocol

emailNotifications.title: Email notifications
emailNotifications.description: Configure the SMTP server and choose which events should trigger emails to your users.
emailNotifications.error: Failed to update email notification settings.

smtp.title: SMTP server
smtp.passwordHint: Leave empty to keep the current password.

preferences.title: Notification triggers
preferences.description: Toggle which user events should send an email.

triggerDescriptions.user_created: Send an email whenever a new user account is created.
triggerDescriptions.user_updated: Notify users when their account configuration changes.
triggerDescriptions.user_deleted: Inform users when their access is removed.
triggerDescriptions.user_limited: Alert users when their data limit is reached.
triggerDescriptions.user_expired: Send a message when a subscription expires.
triggerDescriptions.user_enabled: Notify users when their access is re-enabled.
triggerDescriptions.user_disabled: Inform users when their account is disabled.
triggerDescriptions.data_usage_reset: Tell users when an administrator resets their usage.
triggerDescriptions.data_reset_by_next: Notify users when the next plan cycle starts automatically.
triggerDescriptions.subscription_revoked: Send an email when subscription links are revoked.
triggerDescriptions.reached_usage_percent: Warn users as soon as a usage percentage threshold is crossed.
triggerDescriptions.reached_days_left: Send reminders when only a few days remain before expiration.

usersTable.noUser: There is no user added to the system
usersTable.noUserMatched: It seems there is no user matched with what you are looking for
